Grand Millennium Auckland
8.3 Excellent
Based on 998 reviews

The room was a bit dirty, scuffed walls. It was also cold and took a long time to heat after we put up air conditioning.

There were no extra blankets. The lift would not stop at the floor the pool was located at so we gave up as it was 9.15 and the pool closed at 10. This was supposed to be a treat for us, but it did not feel like one.The person who delivered the desserts came right into our room and that felt a little invasive, we thought maybe he wanted a tip.

Show more
Jonathan , New Zealand
Skycity Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1217 reviews

When booking the hotel, I was surprised the price seemed relatively cheap for what I expected to be a luxurious hotel.

Although it was decent enough, the room was somewhat below par compared to my expectations of a big city casino hotel. The beds were comfortable, clean and spacious however it was the bathroom that was a let down. The bathtub had dirt marks on it and the shower head was dated and weak. The toiletries provided were shower gel, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion but nothing else. Not that it mattered a lot to me but you would think they would at least have toothpaste or a shower cap too. Opening the curtains gave us a unscenic view of the next building's rooftop so we mostly kept it closed. Overall the stay was fine and for the price, I cannot complain too much as the location is fantastic. I suppose I just expected more from Skycity.

Show more
Joyce , Australia
Peppers Bluewater Resort
8.1 Excellent
Based on 906 reviews

Initially we were pleased with our choice of accommodation but this proved to be fleeting. Our room wasn't ready for us at check in and we were asked to come back later.

Sadly, our room had no "manual" to introduce us to our room, the resort or the area we were staying in. Also no guides for the Tv, open fire heating etc. sadly, our kitchen floor was quite soiled too-no five second rule there! The WI FI provided in our room Tarif didn't even cover briefly checking our mail and the WI FI we paid for was incredibly slow. Would we choose to stay with Peppers again? No. Would this stay influence our decision to stay with a Peppers resort elsewhere? Yes.

Show more
Dianne , Australia
The Rees Hotel & Luxury Apartments
8.9 Excellent
Based on 263 reviews

The moment you check in you know you are in the right place. Greeted and checked in a friendly and efficient way and accompanied to my room for explanation, luggage carriage and to install the free wifi connection (with great speed).

It is located on the lake with nice views, a bit out of town centre, but their shuttle bus and water taxi at fixed times to bring you to Queenstown centre is filling that gap. The room is very well decorated with good size bed and comfortable sofa. All rooms are facing the lake and there is a good size balcony. The bathroom has great size with floor and towel heating. With all the comfort I used my room to the maximum during my 2 night stay, although Queenstown has a lot to explore. I did not try any of their restaurant options but am sure this is as good as the rest. This is the place to go if you want to pamper yourself: top service in a very luxury room!

Show more
Anne-Marie , Netherlands
Skycity Grand Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 757 reviews

In my opinion there are no negatives regarding this hotel. The luxury king room was exactly as described on Agoda - big, clean and new.

It was spotless and very well equipped. The wifi was fast and I never experienced a drop out. The hotel is located a short walk (10 min if you're slower) to the waterfront and within range of a number of different bars, pubs, restaurants and shopping. The gym is smaller but everything is new - 2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, lighter dumbbells, balls and mats. There is a deck on level 7 for the smokers. The room service is 24 hours. The staff was professional and polite. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. I read some complaints about the street noise - I was on the 18th floor - it wasn't an issue for me.

Show more
tyler , Canada
Heritage Hotel Queenstown
8 Very good
Based on 177 reviews

room very good, comfortable bed. restaurant good but expensive. my booking did not include breakfast - very unhappy about that because breakfast cost about 20nz.

some people complain about this hotel distance from town but i count it as a plus. makes for a beautiful 10-15 minute walk with great views of lake and mountain - and especially after some of the eating (too much) if the fantastic food available in queenstown. did not like only getting 30 minutes wi-fi connection each day - had to pay for more. hotel at this price should have this full time. good indoor/outdoor pool, hot tub and sauna which i used everyday.

Show more
Edward , United States
Sudima Christchurch Airport
8.3 Excellent
Based on 912 reviews

Booking this for the location as arrival scheduled around 1am. However there are on and off people talking, shower, phone ringing, slamming cupboard door etc etc which did not stop after 4am!! By early morning there are staff talking and chating outside near our door which totally inconsiderate to guest staying.

Although checkin reception was nice but the checkout morning staff was not welcome and not even a simle. 1st time and will be last, will go back to the other airport hotel stayed.

Show more
Sinny , Hong Kong
Scenic Hotel Auckland
8.1 Excellent
Based on 202 reviews

i have tried 4 hotels around the area as i need to stay a couple of nights a week. found this to be the best for a: autentically friendly staff, very helpful and concerned that things went well.

the room was fine 4.13, but the double bed was small, my husband complained about that. but he liked the room, the kitchenette and i think mostly the fact there were two comfy armchairs and a wee table to relax in, in fact that really appealed to me as well. the show had too large a vanity in it, made the ensuite feel small, not really important, you could live with it. we plan to try and stay there for two nights a week, and try for a bigger bed.

Show more
Theresa , New Zealand
Jet Park Airport Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 774 reviews

Location is good only if you need to be close to the airport. Room is generally clean and tidy, apart from the bathroom not being cleaned perfectly and the bin in the bathroom having thick layers of dirt on the outside of it.

It just needs to be replaced with a new one!! Overall the room was good to stay in for one night. The staff were helpful even when we checked in late in the day. We were initially placed in a ground floor room with an accessible bathroom. We asked to be moved to a room with a standard bathroom and this was done immediately. We didn't use any of the facilities as we were only there to be close to the airport in the morning.

Show more
Sonja , Australia
Auckland City Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 805 reviews

The family stayed in the hotel on 2 separate occasions in a fortnight. The first was for 4 nights, the other was for 1 night.

On both occasion, we booked the suite and was assigned the same room 1004. I have no major complaints as everything was great except for the faulty TV in the bigger room. I was able to switch on the TV but no channels was showing as it was not programmed. As I didn't have much time to watch the TV, I didn't inform the reception about it. Sadly, on my second occasion there, it was still faulty! Besides that, the suite was spacious and the bed was comfortable. The staffs were friendly and helpful too. It would be nice if the WIFI is free for the whole day instead for a limited time. Most importantly is that the hotel is nicely located and value for money.

Show more
Saifun , Singapore
Barclay Suites Auckland City Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 335 reviews

The location of the hotel is SUPERB! located just behind Queens street, 3 min walk to Queen street, and just opposite Auckland Sky tower, 5min walk to Auckland Habour.

If you have a planning to stay here, choose high floor with habour view, you will never regret to pay more for the Amazing view. Especially ask for the room no.04 it will be on the right hand side, so you will have two habour view, one on living room and one on the bedroom window. We stay there for two trips, the first trip the room is perfectly clean and we are VERY satisfied with everything, clean pillow, clean bedsheet, with extra 2 blanket, clean toilet,complete cooking utensil and everything is so satisfied. But for our second stay (just 2 days apart) our mood is ruin since check in and feel dissapointed with the room given and the cleaness of the room. But overall will recommended this hotel and we will be back next time.

Show more
Han , Indonesia
Sherwood
8 Very good
Based on 202 reviews

This was the perfect hotel for a couple who were first time visitors to Queenstown (not skiiers) who wanted a zen-like rejuvinating experience in the extreme sport mecca of the world The Sherwood's sustainable concept reminds me of the McMenamins establishments in Oregon and Washington state.

Loved their yoga offerings, farm fresh dining options, sauna/massage, and the curated offerings of live entertainment/concerts. Excellent location: you are only a short bus ride to downtown Queenstown, so you can enjoy its excitement when you want to. If you do ski, Sherwood's location lets you avoid downtown Queenstown traffic jams to/from the slopes. Highly recommended.

Show more
Brett , United States
Kiwi International Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 629 reviews

Everything was paid in full prior yet this hotel wanted to swipe my credit card when I arrived. I expect some sort of welcome when I arrive even if its a surly one.

Everything in the hotel is tired; there was a large tear in my sheet. There were plenty of tea bags and coffee in the room and the room was pleasantly warm; the shared bathroom facilities were kept spotless; the chamber staff was excellent. There is a good choice of eateries within walking distance and a bottle-o across the road. Centre of town is conveniently close.

Show more
William , United Kingdom
Hilton Queenstown Resort and Spa
8.6 Excellent
Based on 441 reviews

We stayed a total of five nights having three different rooms because of our schedule. Each one was clean and so comfortable.

The bed was high quality, the bathrooms modern and spotless with a big tub and great showers. We had a fire place and sitting area with a quality TV. Just the place you wanted to be after a day of travelling. The staff was very professional as well. It was amazing how quickly they got to know us. We did not eat at the hotel but a restraunt associated with them and the food was good but not great and a bit pricey. The location is not ideal as it is on the opposite side of the lake from historic Queenstown but the shuttle and water taxi made up for this. I hope they extend this service to hourly. Overall, it was a great place to stay.

Show more
Denise , United States
Mantra Marina Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 132 reviews

After a little over a week on a roadtrip with several nights sleeping in a campervan these apartments, especially with the lake view, were the perfect way to have a couple of comfortable nights before heading home.

The apartment was clean, comfortable and well equipped, the views across the lake were magnificent, the staff were helpful and friendly throughout our stay. If you do feel the need to be 'in the middle of things' then these apartments may not be for you as Frankton is about 5-6km (4 miles) away from the heart of Queenstown but we knew that on booking and were perfectly happy with that. Hiring bikes and cycling into Queenstown along the Frankton Track was a great way to get into town and good exercise to work off the food we'd eaten! We'll be back.

Show more
Peter , United Kingdom
Cordis Auckland
8.5 Excellent
Based on 387 reviews

A wonderful place to experience New Zealander hospitality. My spouse and I stayed for 2 nights in June and the staff were attentive and professional in helping make this a memorable location.

Room was spacious with older style decor and charm - but well kept and very clean. Located on the top of the hill from the port, about a 20 minute walk down with hotel shuttles running back on a 20 minute schedule - very smart :) Heated pool and whirlpool outdoors kept modern. Huge restaurant options available with choice of hot and cold breakfast buffets for convenience. Not much luck getting good service in the lobby - unfortunate, but this due to its popularity. Management might do well to move resources here for guests to be able to enjoy it more fully. Nice place for a long wind treat with a loved one. Thanks Langham!

Show more
Simon , Canada
Sudima Hotel Auckland Airport
8.2 Excellent
Based on 351 reviews

Everything was as expected for a hotel in this price range until I connected to their wifi - a two hour foc limit.

Now, not only a two hour foc limit, but I arrived at the room and needed to check out an address - 5 minutes and then logged out. Came back after dinner and my two hours had been used up . . . two hours from the time you log on, not use. Now, aside from the fact that charging for wifi these days is simply ludicrous, the sheer audacity of giving a free 'tester' is outrageous Three and a half weeks I was in NZ and ALWAYS had free wifi . . . Shameful really

Show more
Henry , Australia
Villa Del Lago Hotel
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 147 reviews

Wonderful view of the lake from the apartment. Spacious room and living area. Fully equipped kitchen with microwave, oven, stove, and all the necessary utensils.

It was such a delight to know that there is a fireplace! Such a wonderful retreat in the winter. Staff are very helpful and nice. They came right away to our apartment when I was having trouble turning on the stove. We could borrow DVDs for free, with DVD players in the living room. Free wifi service. Staff are helpful in helping you get the right password for wifi access.

Show more
Law , Hong Kong
Oaks Club Resort
8.2 Excellent
Based on 250 reviews

On arrival at the hotel reception and looking out at Lake Wakatipu, we were stung by the speticular view.

The room is well decorated, spacious, clean and very comfortable except it is located a bit back and therefore the lake is almost hidden from our room. We need to go to a viewing gallery on another floor to enjoy the view of the picturesque lake. Perhaps it was the off-peak season, the reception was only manned from 7:00am to 8:00pm which we found to be inconvinient. Another inconvenience was the tour coach for our trip to Milford Sound could not come in to the hotel due to narrow entrance and exit. We have to walk across the road to another motel to wait in the cold and dark for the coach.

Show more
Seng , Malaysia
Pullman Auckland
8.3 Excellent
Based on 250 reviews

Welcoming front office attendants, spacious room with comfortable beds and pillows. Would've liked more bench space in the bathroom.

Great security - housekeeping attendant was servicing our room when we tried to enter. Despite being agitated by our interruption, she obliged and came out and quickly closed the door behind her. Therefore, to gain access, we had to use our own key. It was a bit noisy in the early hours of the morning when the rubbish truck would enter the laneway, but nothing earplugs couldn't fix.

Show more
Fei , Australia
Best Western FINO Hotel & Suites
8.6 Excellent
Based on 119 reviews

We had to make a last min booking due the the earthquake. We called in to the hotel to enquire for availability but were told it was totally full, however we managed to still get a room thru Agoda.

Rooms and apartment was spacious. Location was ok albeit just on the border of the city. Reception is open 24hrs so you dont have to worry about late arrivals. Car park is free too!

Show more
Bernard , Singapore
Peppers Beacon Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 202 reviews

We nicknamed the "Fitness Center" as the "Fitness Cupboard". With just a single stationary bike and single treadmill plus a few barbell weights this is not a fitness center.

The sauna goes for 10 minutes per button press, so you nee to press 3 times before it is hot enough to go in, and you need a key from reception to the spa pool. There are two separated buildings, so get a room in the water view section or you have to get two lifts and cross the carpark to get to your room (although with only 5 floors per lift they are quick). Wifi only in reception. No restaurant, but Queenstown has dozens to choose from (5 minute walk to the center of town).

Show more
Antony , New Zealand
Auckland Airport Kiwi Hotel
7.1 Very good
Based on 853 reviews

Not good. Unhelpful Receptionist. No menu available at Reception and being told to wait until 5pm when restaurant opens to then go and ask for one.

Was also told that "100 metres down the road are several eating places with menus"???? Booked 3 rooms for 8 guests but had to request extra towels and milk for each room - on arrival, only 2 towels/facecloths and 2 satchets of milk in each room! Only 1 pillow each person - expected more. Horrified that any accommodation within cooee of an International Airport only opens for breakfast from 7 am to 9 am, despite the room folder stating it was open until 9 30 am. Sole waiter in restaurant was pleasant, but had too much work to do and we were seated for dinner without enough cutlery and serviettes for our party of 8 and had to request these after our meal was served. Restaurant seriously understaffed for a Saturday night. Meals not up to standard - salad mainly consisted of raw sliced cabbage with no dressing. No trolleys on view/available for luggage and staff only offered help if rooms upstairs. Chipped uneven concrete surfaces outside units. A toaster in the rooms would have been appreciated, particularly as the restaurant was closed when I arrived for breakfast at 2 minutes past 9am. I'm tired of complaining now, so will submit.

Show more
Yvonne , New Zealand
Citylife Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 206 reviews

Very pleasant - parking was a pain - sat in the road for 10 minutes while the poor bellhop sorted his cars in the entrance .

.. apart from that brilliant for families or business people on the move constantly as the apartment had a separate dining / living room and full appliances including washing machine and dryer which were real plus. Seems set up for people who need a city pad - excellent for that. Parking is a pain however that is central city living I guess. Service was excellent though and the front desk very helpful. Foyer is boring but very functional and aces to all Auckland has to offer is fantastic. Well recommended for folk who need a city base - I would certainly use this place again - it beats hands down the super 5 star hotels I have used previously.

Show more
Daryl , New Zealand
Stamford Plaza Auckland Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 327 reviews

I have used the Stamford many times. Its in a great location, central city and close to the wharf and many restaurants and bars Thew room I got was large and clean with all the expected bits and pieces that make life easier But I was irritated by three things.

. 1) The cost of internet. $25 a day and no real shorter usage time option. Its a rip off and I will look elsewherhe next time I am in Auckland 2) The heater in te room did not work, and when I called service that said it was "just warming up". 2 hours later, no change. Eventually partially fixed , but I was cold for hours 3) The lift pass KEPT on malfunctioning. I went to reception 6 times in a 2 day stay to get it "rebooted" Smallish things I grant you, but a cumulative pain in the butt On the plus side rooms were clean, staff friendly and ambiance pleasant

Show more
Greg , Australia
Rydges Auckland
8.3 Excellent
Based on 451 reviews

when we were approaching the hotel, i was slightly disappointed because the hotel seem to be located at a back street, and the lobby design is just so-so.

I have chosen this hotel for our honeymoon while visiting Auckland because the photos from the website have impressed me. Despite the slight disappointment, we soon got overwhelmed by the nicely renovated room. The colour zone is white and grey, and everything looks simple yet clean. Perhaps the hotel is not located at a prominent area and with a vacant site nearby. It is just minutes away from Skycity where there are a few nice eatery. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Show more
Ying , Hong Kong
Best Western President Hotel Auckland
7.9 Very good
Based on 448 reviews

The best about "Best Western President Hotel" is location & everything else is below par. I had stayed over the day & it is very near to sky tower.

In that sense lot more convenient for city shopping or for public transport access. The bad things about this hotel is very old in facilities wise. From Lifts to doors, Aircon to windows everything is thrown back to very old days. Three biggest issues with this hotel is 1. Aircon is noisy - they have very old aircon system which makes lot of noise 2. Windows are not that sound proof - was on 13th floor and still hear noise from the street. 3. Moving beds - The beds I had in room are on wheels although locked. The bed is very uncomfortable when you move around the bed. Staff is good & very supportive.

Show more
Raja , New Zealand
Hotel Grand Windsor
8.6 Excellent
Based on 55 reviews

Grand Mercure Auckland
8.3 Excellent
Based on 27 reviews

Willis Wellington Hotel
7.5 Very good
Based on 698 reviews

Good staff friendly and helpful. The room decor was outdated old and some areas quite dusty. Location was handy to where I needed to be at the time, nice dining area but way under utilised, breakfast buffet option but no restaurant option for lunch or dinner! The bread was stale as heck over the time I was there, never fresh.

The other food was below average really not worth the $19.50 it cost. Would not recommend and would not stay again, unless they lift their game dramatically, it's a no thanks from me.

Show more
Royce , New Zealand
Millbrook Resort
9.4 Exceptional
Based on 100 reviews

Orari Bed & Breakfast
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 90 reviews

Situated close to the heart of Christchurch, the Orari bed and breakfast is a converted Victorian era mansion, set in a mature garden of the same era.

It has the advantage of being close to a restaurant area and parks but avoids the noise of central city hotelsIt is furnished along these lines with magnificent furniture and decor in the public areas such as the breakfast room, such as a magnificent dining table and sideboard and a wonderful art deco standard lamp together with some fine art and prints. TheVictorian themed decor, although continued in a less grand manner in the bedrooms has been supplemented by modern conveniences such as ensuite bathrooms in some rooms and access to bathrooms in the remaining rooms. I thought, Orari's proprietors were very helpful their guests personal advice and the lounge/dining room features a small library as well as menus from neighbouring restaurants. Breakfast is a highlight, with a wide selection of jams/jellies in small jars a cooked breakfast with a variety of breads as well as tea served in silver teapots.

I can't really rate the food/dining as the hotel offers none and this survey should have a N/A button or does not apply to give a better rating. Show more Mark , United States The Waterfront Apartments 8.5 Excellent Based on 70 reviews Plenty of space with a beautiful outlook onto the lake. It is in walking distance to all restaurants and shops and no hills to climb! This is an excellent place to stay as long as you are aware that it is an apartment without any service and there is no restaurant. It has a kitchenette where you can make your own food. The bathroom is equipped with a good hairdryer and some soap but very little else. You are given 2 sets of towels with the option to have more if you would like them. Bed was comfortable and the lounge room is well equipped. The manager is friendly - free WIFI is included which is great. I would give it a high rating but not as a hotel, but as an apartment. Make sure you get an apartment that is numbered 1 - 9 otherwise you don't get much of a view. We had a little mishap on the first evening as the floor heating for one of the toilets triggered off a short circuit in the house and we were stuck with no electricity for a few hours. Took some time for the management to send an electrician over and we were stuck with having takeouts for dinner.. Regardless that doesn't matter as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay with the big comfy beds and cosy ambiance of the whole place. Thumbs up!
